title: TB does not sync ALL iCloud contacts
content:
Hi.

I am using TB 102.11.2 (64-Bit) in German. Installed add on "Provider for CalDAV & CardDAV" and "TbSync". My iCloud contact list contains more than 300 addresses.

If I create a new contact in TB, it will be immediately synced to iCloud. If I change a contact in TB, it will also be immediately synced to iCloud. But I have two contacts, which are not synced, and I dont know why. This contacts I imported to TB from Outlook via .vcf file. Both contains images of the users. And both are shown in TB.

I am unsure, if "Provider for CalDAV & CardDAV" is necessary, I read a post with the info, that TB includes now native support for both protocols. Nevertheless, the problem still exists, even if I deactive this add on and sync again.

In the past, I also have had a problem with some contacts. I think it was a problem with some

Where can I find a log? How to debug this problem? Please help...

Thank you for your help! Kai

title: Difficulty installing Owl for Exchange addon on Thunderbird Windows
content:
Hello everyone,

I hope you're doing well. I am currently facing an issue with installing the Owl for Exchange addon on Thunderbird for Windows. I have successfully installed it on Linux, but unfortunately, I'm unable to replicate the process on my Windows machine.

The purpose of installing this addon is to synchronize my institutional Outlook account with Thunderbird. Despite following the installation steps carefully, the addon doesn't seem to work properly, in fact doesn't appear as an option when I try to add an account. I've tried reinstalling Thunderbird and the addon multiple times, but with no success.

I was wondering if anyone else has encountered a similar problem or has any idea why this might be happening specifically on Windows. Are there any additional configurations or dependencies required for the addon to work on Windows? Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

Best regards,

title: Fetching mail issuess Outlook365
content:
I'm a long time user of Thunderbird Version102.11.2 and now I am perplexed .. Using Windows 11. My primary business accounts are Outlook 365 through GoDaddy. All has worked well until last night. Thunderbird is set to check for mail every 3 minutes. If there is something to download it does. If there is nothing to download I get:

Sending of password for user jeff@xxxxx.net did not succeed. Mail server outlook.office365.com responded: Authentication failure: unknown user name or bad password.

If I click " get messages" sometimes it does and sometimes it doesn't and I get the same or similar messaage.. If I try to send email I get

"Login to server outlook.office365.com with username jeff@xxxxx failed."

Its not a password or login issue. Emails go to phone and tablets just fine

Other accounts with other servers are working fine ..its just the Outlook 365 accounts. Something changed somewhere but my limited skill can't figure this out.

Thoughts/suggestions ?

title: Update your settings to keep your email app access working.
content:
I got this in my Email account. Thunderbird no longer supports this change, "There are email accounts in your organization using Basic Authentication, which Microsoft will no longer support after 05/12/2023. You'll still be able to access your email through your browser, but not from an email app, such as Outlook or Apple Mail — don't worry, none of your emails will be lost.

In order to continue using your email apps, you need to update your settings from POP/IMAP to Exchange for each device you use to check your email. This also applies to other users who are set up within your account using POP/IMAP settings. Here's how to update your email settings."

Consequently, I had to download and use a different email client to get my email.

Are you going to fix this so I can continue using Thunderbird for this email account?

title: How to get Thunderbird 102.11.2 to work with Godaddy/Exchange/Office365/M365/Outlook?
content:
Around 5/13/2023, after Microsoft disable Basic Authentication and disabled POP accounts, I was able to create a new Thunderbird IMAP account, using OAuth, that will auto retrieve the email from my Godaddy account (I do miss POP). But, I have not been able to configure the Thunderbird IMAP account to allow me to send email out through the Godaddy/Exchange/Office365/M365/Outlook email server. Also, everything I see about Owl or ExQuilla is dated 2022 or earlier. Is Owl or ExQuilla still the only solution to be able to send email? Does anyone know how to do this, and if so, can you share how to do it or point me to the info I need? I would think Owl or ExQuilla would no longer needed with the most current version of Thunderbird.

To send email, currently my only solution is to use my web access to my account at Godaddy/Exchange/Office365/M365/Outlook. I truly hate the Outlook interface and the way it handles the names, I haven’t found any equivalent to “Display Name” in Thunderbird and I cannot live in a first name only world when looking at a list of email.

Another question: Is there anyway to make an IMAP account work like a POP account? I prefer to leave nothing on the email server. I like retrieving the email when I want to check it, vs having it pushed to me. I also like deleting it from the server after I have retrieved it and just keeping the email in my email client. I have lots and lots of folders and filters for both my incoming and sent email and I do NOT want to try recreating it for Outlook.

I hope someone has experience with this Godaddy/Exchange/Office365/M365/Outlook problem and how it works with Thunderbird 102.11.2.
creator: at1357

title: TB beta 114.0b6 - cannot set folder/thread colors
content:
Up until I upgraded to the beta circuit today, I was using TB V102.<something>

I use a third-party desktop configuration program called WindowBlinds to set system colors and themes; it has always been able to set colors in Thunderbird with no issue... until I installed this beta version... Now, I simply get black text on bright white background, regardless of WindowBlinds theme.

So I tried falling back on using Thunderbird settings... in Settings-> General -> Fonts & Colors, I have tried all combinations that I could think of, but *none* of them affect the Local Folders Folders and Messages display colors.

Specifically, I have: > Enabled "Allow messages to use other fonts" > Under Colors window, have both set and cleared "Use system colors" If I SET "Use system colors", then all of the Settings tabs use the WindowBlinds colors, but neither Local Folders nor Calendar use them. If I CLEAR "Use system colors", then all of the Settings tabs use the fgnd/bgnd colors that I specify in the Colors dialog.

I *really* want *all* of the windows to use my system colors, which were set by WindowBlinds... that's how it all worked before... that bright-white background on the message panes is Ghastly!!! I cannot bear to look at it...
creator: dan7miller

title: E-mails sumiram da caixa de entrada
content: Olá! Recentemente ao ser admitido num setor da prefeitura, percebi que utilizavam um servidor de e-mail compatível com o Thunderbird (Locaweb), e resolvi testa-lo em meu computador, no intuito de caso gostassem, inserissem o uso do software em todo o setor, devido sua praticidade e funcionalidade, porém, nas últimas semanas, percebemos que na conta de e-mail do setor, sumiram da pasta caixa de entrada alguns e-mails essenciais. Imediatamente suspendi o uso do Thunderbird, fiz a remoção da conta, e voltei a usar no navegador, porém, são mensagens antigas essenciais ao setor, que precisamos recuperar, e acessando as pastas internas, verifiquei haver ali alguns arquivos de extensão msf, (inbox, trash) que possivelmente, pela data de criação e tamanho, possam conter as mensagens desaparecidas, preciso resolver isso amanhã, ou pode me custar o emprego, pois os e-mails que sumiram, fazem parte dos processos do setor, é necessário que eles retornem ao servidor do Locaweb para aparecer em sua caixa de entrada, poderiam me orientar quanto a esse processo de importação? Se é possível qual o procedimento, isso realmente está me preocupando, meu intuito era apenas ajudar, mas virou um transtorno. Ajudem-me por favor.
creator: eliasferreiracontact
